text:
[PATCH]   

Attached are some files in fop0.20.5 which I changed for improving performance.
In my project I noticed improvements of about 10%. Basically, I used
JProbe to identify excessive calls in FOP code and found that several 
expensive calls (especially to PropertyListManager) could be eliminated by 
storing
some of the results in the caller itself for later use.
The following is the list of files included in this zip file. 

Thanks,
Sankara Tanguturi
sankara_tanguturi@yahoo.com


> org.apache.fop.fo.PropertyListBuilder.java

Eliminates unnecessary calls to findMaker function by storing it as a member 
variable.
findMaker is expensive and is called from several member functions in 
PropertyListBuilder.
By storing it the first time it is called and reusing when space, element, 
attribute fields
match, the total calls are cut down.

> org.apache.fop.fo.flow.AbstractTableBody.java

Eliminated duplicate calls to   getBorderAndPadding,  
getBackkgroundProps,       
getHyphenationProps, getMarginProps in layout by storing old values.

> org.apache.fop.fo.flow.Block.java

Eliminated duplicate calls to   getBorderAndPadding,  
getBackkgroundProps,       
getHyphenationProps, getMarginProps in layout by storing old values.

> org.apache.fop.fo.flow.Table.java

Eliminated duplicate calls to   getBorderAndPadding,  
getBackkgroundProps,       
getHyphenationProps, getMarginProps in layout by storing old values.

> org.apache.fop.fo.flow.TableCell.java

Made BorderAndPadding returned by propMgr.getBorderAndPadding() in doSetup as a 
member variable 
so that the call could be avoided in layout.

jeremias@apache.org
text:
A few comments to your submission:
- Sending us complete Java files is not such a good idea because we cannot see 
immediately what changed. To see that you have to manually diff the files.
- Even more important you didn't do your changes against the latest files in 
CVS. This again makes it very difficult to apply the patch. And it takes a LOT 
of time. Please send CVS patches next time (See URL below).
- Your changes need to be revisited. You've introduced quite a bit of 
duplicate code (ex. in PropertyListBuilder). That can be improved to make it 
more readable.
- Now the hammer: We appreciate your effort to improve FOP's performance very 
much but unfortunately, we have set the maintenance branch of FOP to bugfixing 
mode only. The branch will be frozen after 0.20.5 so we can focus on the 
redesign. I can only speak for myself, but I'd rather not apply your changes. 
I'm sorry I have to say this.

I would like to encourage you to read the instructions on contributing to FOP. 
You can find them here: http://xml.apache.org/fop/dev/index.html

(fellow committers: reopen the bug if I'm totally out of line.)

<Q>
Using member variables may also be beneficial for the logger functionality, 
given the many getLogger().xxxx() calls currently in the trunk branch.
</Q>

Sure, but it also blows up the instance/object size and if there are a lot of 
instances (like in the FO tree) this can quickly account for a lot more memory 
which in turn can slow down things again. We would have to investigate that 
very carefully. But I think it's too soon to improve speed in the trunk.
